perturbation.original_text: 1.54 "Sales Representative" shall mean an individual employed and compensated by Valeant as a full-time employee as part of its sales forces and who engages in Detailing of the Designated Product (or the Alternate Product, as the case may be) in the Territory, and who is also trained with respect to the Product in accordance with this Agreement (including the Product Labeling and the use of the Promotional Materials) to deliver Details for the Product in the Field in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.54 "Sales Representative" shall mean an individual contracted or employed by Valeant, and who engages in Detailing of the Designated Product (or the Alternate Product, as the case may be) in the Territory, and who is also trained with respect to the Product in accordance with this Agreement (including the Product Labeling and the use of the Promotional Materials) to deliver Details for the Product in the Field in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "employed and compensated by Valeant as a full-time employee" to "contracted or employed by Valeant" introduces ambiguity and potential misclassification of workers. This creates uncertainty about whether Sales Representatives are employees or independent contractors, impacting wage and hour law compliance.
perturbation.law_explanation: The modification potentially contradicts the FLSA, which mandates minimum wage and overtime pay for employees but not for independent contractors. Misclassifying employees as contractors to avoid these obligations is a violation of the FLSA.

perturbation.original_text: 4.3.2 Neither Valeant nor Field Force Personnel shall offer, pay, solicit or receive any remuneration to or from Target Professionals, in order to induce referrals of or purchase of the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3.2 Valeant and Field Force Personnel may offer, pay, solicit or receive any remuneration to or from Target Professionals, in order to induce referrals of or purchase of the Product, provided such actions are fully disclosed to Dova.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a direct contradiction by suggesting it may be allowable for Valeant or Field Force Personnel to offer remuneration, so long as it is disclosed to Dova. This introduces the potential for illegal kickbacks.
perturbation.law_explanation: This modification directly contradicts the Anti-Kickback Statute, which prohibits offering or paying anything of value to induce referrals for services or items paid for by federal healthcare programs. Disclosure to Dova does not legalize an otherwise illegal kickback.

perturbation.original_text: 9.1 Confidential Information. 9.1.1 Confidentiality and Non-Use. Each Party agrees that, during the Term and for a period of [***] thereafter, it shall keep confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose and shall not use for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement (which includes the exercise of its rights or performance of any obligations hereunder) any Confidential Information furnished to it by or on behalf of the other Party pursuant to this Agreement, except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1 Confidential Information. 9.1.1 Confidentiality and Non-Use. Each Party agrees that, during the Term and for a period of [***] thereafter, it shall keep confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose and shall not use for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement (which includes the exercise of its rights or performance of any obligations hereunder) any Confidential Information furnished to it by or on behalf of the other Party pursuant to this Agreement, except if compelled by a subpoena.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the exceptions that require the written consent of the parties, the clause now allows confidential information to be disclosed if compelled by subpoena. Subpoenas are subject to challenges, and this alteration means that it is permissible to disclose confidential information even if a subpoena is successfully challenged.
perturbation.law_explanation: The modification potentially contradicts FRCP 45, which outlines procedures for subpoenas, including the ability to object and seek protection from undue burden or disclosure of privileged information. By not requiring consent or an attempt to obtain a protective order, the altered clause undermines the protections afforded by Rule 45.
